data.title: Justin Leroy Harris – Historic Union Cemetery
data.text:
SUICIDE BARES WIFE’S MURDER TEN DAYS AGO

Husband Kills Self In S. F. Hotel: Mate’s Body Found In Redwood City Home

SAN FRANCISCO. Jan 10 – Details of a suicide letter, in which a man known as T. M. Harrison, golf professional who shot and killed himself in a hotel here, described the slaying of his wife ten days ago, were checked today.

The wife, known to neighbors as Mrs. Myrtle Adele Harrison, was found shot to death in her bed at the couple’s Redwood City home last night after the letter, written to the San Francisco Examiner, was turned over to authorities.

In his letter, the supposed Harrison, who had registered at the hotel under the name of Morrison, said his true identity was Justin Leroy Harris and that he killed his wife as she slept.

He said before coming to California about a year ago he was engaged as a golf professional at the Valley View Golf Club of Hanover, N. J., and that he was once dean of a fine arts of an Enid, Okla, university.

The letter told of his life from his boyhood and said his father, a former Illinois minister, was dead. He said his first position was in a bank at Morton, Ill. from which he was discharged for falsifying records.

Later, he continued, he and his sister organized a ------ conservatory at Bloomington with a branch at Paxton. They then moved to Enid, Okla., he added, where he claimed he eventually obtained the university position.

LAUDS FIRST WIFE

It was during this same period, this letter said, Harris married his first wife Lucie, now dead. “My first wife, a lovely cultured lady, is buried in St. Louis” he stated.

He said he and his second wife, who was found dead in their Redwood City home, were married in Belleville, “across the river from St. Louis”.

Harris, in the letter, said his alleged ----- with Valley View Golf Club followed a period in Chicago during which he worked the free lot racket and swindled a friend of $3000.

The decision to kill his wife and commit suicide, the letter said, came after a visit to Del Monte and the insurance of ----- checks to invest the expenses.

PROMINENT IN THE END

ENID, Okla. Jan 10 – Justin Leroy Harris reported to have killed himself in a San Francisco hotel, once was a prominent in musical circles here.

He was dean of the fine arts department of Phillips University in 1913-14. He also directed the choir of the First Baptist Church.

Harris left Enid in 1914.
